hints.label: thm-lsi-qsd
hints.title: Log-Sobolev Inequality (LSI) for QSD
hints.content:
3998: :label: thm-lsi-qsd
3999: 
4000: There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $\rho$ on $\Omega$:
4001: 
4002: $$
4003: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty)
4004: 
4005: $$
hints.raw_directive:
3995: The core of hypocoercivity is relating Fisher information to KL divergence:
3996: 
3997: :::{prf:theorem} Log-Sobolev Inequality (LSI) for QSD
3998: :label: thm-lsi-qsd
3999: 
4000: There exists a constant $\lambda_{\text{LSI}} > 0$ such that for all probability densities $\rho$ on $\Omega$:
4001: 
4002: $$
4003: D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) \le \frac{1}{2\lambda_{\text{LSI}}} I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty)
4004:

hints.label: thm-lsi-constant-explicit
hints.title: Explicit LSI Constant
hints.content:
4064: :label: thm-lsi-constant-explicit
4065: 
4066: The LSI constant for the QSD satisfies:
4067: 
4068: $$
4069: \boxed{\lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}}
4070: 
4071: $$
4072: 
4073: where:
hints.raw_directive:
4061: The true QSD $\rho_\infty^x(v)$ is not exactly Gaussian, but it's close (bounded perturbation). Using perturbative LSI theory (Holley-Stroock):
4062: 
4063: :::{prf:theorem} Explicit LSI Constant
4064: :label: thm-lsi-constant-explicit
4065: 
4066: The LSI constant for the QSD satisfies:
4067: 
4068: $$
4069: \boxed{\lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}}
4070: 
4071: $$
4072: 
4073: where:
4074: - $\alpha_{\exp}$ is the exponential concentration rate from (R6)

hints.label: proof-thm-lsi-constant-explicit
hints.content:
4078: :::{prf:proof}
4079: :label: proof-thm-lsi-constant-explicit
4080: The proof follows from the Holley-Stroock perturbation theorem. The reference Gaussian measure $\mu(v) = (2\pi/\alpha_{\exp})^{-d/2} e^{-\alpha_{\exp}|v|^2/2}$ has LSI constant $\lambda_0 = \alpha_{\exp}$.
4081: 
4082: The log-ratio $\log(\rho_\infty^x / \mu)$ satisfies:
4083: 
4084: $$
4085: \left|\Delta_v \log \frac{\rho_\infty^x}{\mu}\right| = |\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty^x - \Delta_v \log \mu| = |\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty^x + \alpha_{\exp} d|
4086: 
4087: $$
4088: 
4089: Using $\|\Delta_v \log \rho_\infty\|_{L^\infty} \le C_{\Delta v}$:
4090: 
4091: $$
4092: \left|\Delta_v \log \frac{\rho_\infty^x}{\mu}\right| \le C_{\Delta v} + \alpha_{\exp} d
4093: 
4094: $$
4095: 
4096: The Holley-Stroock theorem gives:
4097: 
4098: $$
4099: \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\lambda_0}{1 + C_{\text{perturb}}/\lambda_0}
4100: 
4101: $$
4102: 
4103: where $C_{\text{perturb}} = C_{\Delta v}$. Substituting $\lambda_0 = \alpha_{\exp}$:
4104: 
4105: $$
4106: \lambda_{\text{LSI}} \ge \frac{\alpha_{\exp}}{1 + C_{\Delta v}/\alpha_{\exp}}
4107:

hints.label: lem-fisher-bound
hints.title: Fisher Information Bound
hints.content:
4159: :label: lem-fisher-bound
4160: 
4161: There exists a constant $c_F > 0$ such that:
4162: 
4163: $$
4164: I_v(\rho) \ge c_F I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{rem}}
4165: 
4166: $$
4167: 
4168: where $c_F = 1/2$ and $C_{\text{rem}} = 4C_{\nabla v}^2$.
4169: 
4170: Consequently:
4171: 
4172: $$
4173: \boxed{I_v(\rho) \ge 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{LSI}}}
4174: 
4175: $$
hints.raw_directive:

4165:

4167: 
4168: where $c_F = 1/2$ and $C_{\text{rem}} = 4C_{\nabla v}^2$.
